runs.comm: nice swing first up, 136ks, on a length well outside off, then shaping back in. Charles leaves it alone
fuller, nearly a half-volley, driven square to cover-point
nice, straighter and swinging in, Charles has to hurry lest he be called dead plumb
this one swings away. Really full, and starts wide too, and called wide
full and straight now, nearly a yorker, dug out to mid-on
full, widish, driven square, to cover-point
full, middle and leg, driven wide of mid-on, takes the single. Gayle kept away from the strike for some more
Charles moves well across to a full delivery, and lucky the ball is too straight, otherwise he would have been lbw
and the big man steals a quick single. Pushed straight to mid-off, who is sitting back because of the Gayle force, and they run a single
full, on off, pushed to mid-on
Charles opens up. First boundary of the second semi-final. Fullish, into the pads, he opens up front leg, and lofts this over midwicket. It meets the boundary cushions on a half-volley
plays a tentative defensive shot now, gets an inside edge to a full delivery
that's a swipe. Good-old Twenty20 swipe. Clears the front leg, and goes right across the line, hoping for the best as he does so. And it goes uppishly, but wide of mid-on
full, swinging away as expected, gets a thick outside edge of the defensive bat for a single to third man
full and wide, driven without getting close to it, gets a soft edge on it, which falls well short of slip, but White is superb at slip
dug in short, 137ks, Gayle plays the defensive shot off the front foot
dug in again, looking to tuck him up, but strays too far down leg
thick edge again. Two moral victories for Starc. Gayle gets a second single to third man

Charles is gone. Starc has struck. Perhaps this attack is too good for him. Starc has been swinging the ball back in, but this is short of a length, and goes with the angle. All Charles manages is an edge through to Wade
and he produces a thick inside edge right away, which goes for a single to fine leg
short of a length, angling in, dropped into the leg side for one
short of a length, pitching outside leg, angling towards leg, worked away for another single
Samuels is dealing in edges at the moment. Drives at a wide length ball without getting close to it, and gets a bottom edge that's safe
that's silken. End of edges for Samuels. Just stands tall and meets a length ball with a slightly open face, placing it wide of mid-off
short, 148ks, hurries him into the pull, but the mis-hit lands safe and yields a single
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover-point
length ball, into the pads, that was a freebie, but he concedes just the leg-bye
Gayle swings and misses. Watson nearly gets his man. He clears the front leg and goes over cow corner, but all he connects is thin air
Watson slips in the bouncer, and Gayle ducks under it
appeal for leg-before, but this is short of a length, not swinging, and hitting middle and leg, so it has to be pitched outside leg
full and straight, pushed wide of mid-on for one
Gayle 1, Watson 0. Deep deep into the stands. Length ball, outside off, Gayle goes straight now, and makes a sweet connection. And it sails over long-off
and edge first up. Samuels is lucky it has not carries to slip as he opens the face
Samuels is lucky again. This was dead plumb. Umpire Dar has had a slip. This is full, pitches middle, straightens, and is missing both the leg and off stumps. Samuels has got away with one here
short, gets a bottom edge on the cut
Samuels gets into the six-hitting act. Full, middle and leg, pretty similar to the leg-before delivery, but he has lofted it clean over long-on
cut away in front of square

this was on the cards, but to the first ball he aces from regulation left-arm spin? Doherty stays round the stumps to cut the angle, but he still lands it in Gayle's swinging zone, and Gayle sends it rows behind deep midwicket
never mind the bat's thickness. This one was played so well he could have hit a six with a ruler. Right down to the pitch of the ball, dead straight, and off the middle of the bat
a grubber. Samuels is beaten by the low bounce, Wade does well to collect it and attempt a stumping. When he played the cut, Samuels was outside the crease, but got the back foot back in time
googly, Samuels seems to have picked it off the pitch, but has recovered well to defend
the legbreak now, but a bit too short. Samuels, though, finds point with the cut
wrong'un again. The line outside leg seems to be a giveaway, but he draws another defensive shot out of Samuels
they had Gayle where they wanted him, taking a tight single as Samuels dabbed it to backward point, but those strides are big enough to get him in in time
no, he bowls full, and pays the price. Sameuls moves half-forward, makes room by opening the front leg a bit, and then smacks it over extra cover. Split seconds later, it hits the advertising boards
Timbahhh. Slower ball at 116ks, and the middle stump lays flat. Samuels plays the odd ungainly slog this time, and is comprehensively deceived by the slower one
full, outside off, stylishly driven to sweeper-cover
slower ball, short of a length, punched square for a single
full and straight, defended by Bravo
another slower ball, defended off the front foot. Top over from Cummins
full, really full, don't know which way it is turning because it is a yorker. Hit back to him
nice delivery, pitches on leg, just short of driving length, turning sharply towards off, swept away softly
it's a googly first up, Bravo stays back and pushes it to Watson at point

David Hussey's first touch in this tournament is a no-touch. And what a shot he has had to field first up. An inside-out loft from Bravo that bounces just short of him at long-off and then bursts through the hands
flighted nicely, defended
quicker delivery, and if not a googly it at least went on with the angle. Beats the Bravo cut
short of a length, not in his swinging arc, and Gayle defends
full, on off, in his swinging arc, and it goes for a flat six over long-on. Not surprising. Caught well by a policeman in front of the sight screen
swept away for a single. Doherty will be relieved
X man slows it down now, cut away for an easy single
shorter than Gayle expects it, Gayle sweeps, is beaten by the turn, but takes the leg-bye
full, on off, pushed towards long-on for one
short of a length, dabbed to short third man
full, straight and quick, dug out for a single to deep midwicket
short, outside off, punched away for another single
stays full, straight and low again. Not letting him get under it. Another single to long-on
is that a difficult difficult drop?. No it's byes. A real toughie. A high full toss from Hussey, which Bravo misses, and it is really asking for too much for a keeper to collect it
driven down the ground for another single
full, angling in, driven to long-on
you can't swing it from there. Full, well down leg, five wides
lovely comeback from Starc. A yorker swinging in towards off. Gayle can't do much with it
full, swinging in, pushed to long-on for one
angling in, no room, pushed to midwicket
full toss outside off, Bravo manages just an edge that bounces well short of Wade
driven with an open face, gets a single to third man
length ball, angling into the pads, and he misses on that
short of a length, no room, defended back
flicked away extravagantly, and he wrists it away wide of a diving Bailey at midwicket
and Bravo starts hitting sixes now. Length ball, middle and leg, and he moves forward to loft this over long-on: six sixes and three fours off the bat so far
driven straight of midwicket for a single
No it isn't. It's short of a length, has pitched outside leg, and Gayle has glanced this fine of the diving short fine leg
wrong'un but too short, and Bravo goes right back into the crease to smack this for a flat six. Not too wide of deep midwicket, but you only have to miss them by a few feet if you hit so powerfully
full, turning in, beats him in the fight, gets a dot
Bravo is not picking them. Pushes tentatively to this full delivery, and defends it back
tries the big drive, never mind reading the spin, gets an edge to short third man
quicker lebreak, Gayle waits for it, and opens the face to take a single
down the wicket, Hogg bowls short, Bravo gets a single to long-off
full, on off, driven to deep cover for one

that was a good ball. Hussey again managed to not let him get under the ball. Full, straight, low, Gayle gets an inside edge, and it hurtles across, wide of long-on. How badly do you make Gayle to mis-hit to get him out or keep him down to one?
quick, 104ks, and finally Hussey lets Gayle get under the ball. And where has it gone? Second tier. Over the straight boundary, which is the long boundary. Joint-biggest six of the tournament

brave attempt by Starc He has taken it on the chin. Gayle goes across the line, mis-hits, deep midwicket is interested but it is not carrying. Starc, though, goes for the catch, falls well short, is hit on the chin, but shows no pain
what do you do Jack? You have bowled a yorker, you have not allowed Gayle to get under the ball, and he still squeezes it fine of short third man. Fifty for Gayle. The dugout is having a ball
slow ball, short of a length, and punched away to deep cover
well bowled, slower short one at 110ks, Gayle pulls out of the shot. Cummins gives him the stare too
another slower ball, on a length, pitched outside leg, turning towards the stumps, worked away for a single
this is unfair on the bowlers. Somebody has to regulate these bats. Slower ball, a clear mis-hit, it seems to have gone up into the orbit, but it clears long-off

good field placement. It's Bailey himself at straight extra cover and Bravo has hit this length ball straight to him. Some relief for Australia, but West Indies keep coming at you with their big hitters: Pollard, Russell and Sammy to follow
full, middle and off, pushed into the on side with soft hands, and they have made a belated decision to take the second, but so huge are their strides they make it easily
thick inside edge. Four. No country for bowlers. Length ball, on leg, Gayle clears the front leg and swings. That beats the diving deep square
slower ball, late-cuts it, finds short third man
yorker, dug out, Watson is so desperate to keep Gayle off strike he chases after it and fields it with a slide
short of a length, no room, defended off the front foot
slower bouncer, Pollard sways out of it, Wade gets it on a half-volley, and lets two byes through. Gets the look from Watson
slower legcutter, pushed into the off side, keeps the strike
full, into the pads, 147ks, the bottom edge goes for two
low full toss, can't get under it, hit to long-on. Gayle almost walks the single
called a wide. Cummins bowls the bouncer, Gayle ducks under it. Too high it is

"You can tell he is gone now, he is hitting only fours." Classic commentary from David Lloyd. Gayle premeditated a front-foot movement, Cummins bowled short, and he still managed to pull it wide of deep midwicket
Bailey has saved three here. This was smashed with some force to his left at extra cover, and he put a full-length dive in
slower offcutter, turning down leg, lucky that Pollard has found short fine. Gayle not running any tight singles now
what do you do with these batsmen and these bats? It's almost a yorker, cramping him, but Pollard has flicked it so well he has bisected long-on and deep midwicket
Length ball, into the pads, gone. Can't bowl length to him. Gayle has flicked this, merely flicked this, into the West Indies dugout around the midwicket area
yorker, swinging in, squeezes under his bat. Rare dot
nice again. Full, swinging in to him, can't get under it. The inside edge onto the pad yields just the one
full toss, into the pads, flicked away, Michael Hussey over-runs this at deep midwicket. That's a rare rare error from Hussey. That kind of night for Australia
who'dathunk it? Pollard down on a knee, under the full ball, and guiding it over the keeper's head. Gayle is so impressed he practises that shot at the non-striker's end
yorker, angling in from round the stumps, still place wide of long-on for two. Gayle will be on strike for the first ball of the last over
full toss first ball. Gayle stands tall and pulls this over midwicket for his 16th six of the tournament
full, on leg, misses out, takes one to short fine leg. He looks in pain when running
that's a flat slog-sweep that doesn't seem to have much elevation on it, but it is enough to clear a leaping Hogg at deep midwicket who gets a hand on it
low full toss, wide outside off, Pollard clears the front leg and hits it for a six over long-off. This is carnage. Call the ambulance. It's a car wreck, this over
Gayle is dancing already. First 200 of the tournament. Full, middle and leg, smoked straight for yet another six. Gayle can't wait for after the match

oh finally a mis-hit finds a fielder. Pollard is looking for a fourth straight six, but this time he slices it high, high, high, and Warner takes a safe catch at long-off. Warner will have to do much more with the bat if we are going to have a match tonight
